result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julie Kay Johnson

records.addlTxt:
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John. H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:43 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Julie Kay Johnson in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Julie Kay Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD.  DE confirms address on file. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond argument. Court orders bond. Adjourned at 1:45 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
